world

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • world.World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple world class containing an array of Tiles making up the world. Used for representing a game world as an array.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      World(int width, int height)
      Due to restrictions in world creation (see world.World.createWorld()), the world should always be of odd width and height.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void generateGoal()
      Generates a goal to a random corner of world.
      void generateStart()
      Generates a sane starting position, so the player won't spawn inside a wall or outside the array.
      int[] getGoal() 
      int getHeight() 
      int[] getStart() 
      Tile getTile(int a, int b) 
      int getWidth() 
      void printWorld()
      Prints the whole World array.
      void render(Player p)
      ASCII render method for playing the game in command line environment.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • World

        public World(int width,
             int height)
        Due to restrictions in world creation (see world.World.createWorld()), the world should always be of odd width and height. Creates a new World, with given parameters and generates start and goal Tiles, also spawns monsters to Tiles based on world.World.spawnMonsters() (frequency can be adjusted). Last creates some opening to the maze to make the world feel less cramped.
        Parameters:
        width - World width
        height - World height

      • render

        public void render(Player p)
        ASCII render method for playing the game in command line environment.
        Parameters:
        p - Player object for referencing relative position.

      • printWorld

        public void printWorld()
        Prints the whole World array. For testing purposes only.

      • generateStart

        public void generateStart()
        Generates a sane starting position, so the player won't spawn inside a wall or outside the array.

      • getStart

        public int[] getStart()

      • generateGoal

        public void generateGoal()
        Generates a goal to a random corner of world.

      • getGoal

        public int[] getGoal()
